Russ Feingold: s campaign promises in 1992: Feingold introduced himself as a regular guy supported by regular guys and made campaign promises to take the majority of his funding from Wisconsin residents, not out-of-state residents or interest groups.
Feingold: s explanation of the pledge: Feingold clarified that his pledge to get a majority of his contributions from Wisconsin citizens in 1992 was only for that specific term and not a lifelong commitment. He stated that his pledge was always for the campaign at hand.
Reversal of Feingold: s position in the 2016 campaign: In the 2016 rematch against Ron Johnson, Feingold changed his stance and started accepting the majority of his funding from out-of-state sources, breaking his previous promise.
